alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:40PM EST until December 19 at 6:53PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting Belknap and Grafton Counties. Pemigewasset River At Woodstock affecting Grafton County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pemigewasset River at Plymouth. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flood waters 5 to 6 feet deep on route 175A in Holderness. This level will exceed that observed in the aftermath of Hurricane Irene in 2011 by about a half foot. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:31 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
